repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.unittitle: Man in the Northeast Magazine Collection
did.abstract: This collection contains issues of Man in the Northeast, a magazine focused on anthropological research in Northeastern North America.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files in this collection are arranged chronologically.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed in 2018 by Miles Lawlor. The materials in this collection were removed from the University Publications collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains copies of the anthropological research magazine Man in the Northeast, covering most issues of the magazine released between 1982 and 1991. While the magazine released a number of volumes before this time, Man in the Northeast appears to have begun publishing under the auspices of the various Institutes within Albany's Department of Anthropology in the Spring of 1983. It is during this period when Man in the Northeast was published in Albany that this collection focuses upon. Currently no copies before Issue #24 or after Issue #42 are held.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.

The M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collection and Archives is eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Man in the Northeast is a magazine focusing on anthropological research in the Northeastern United States. Between at least 1982 and 1991, the magazine was published by the Department of Anthropology at the State Univerisity of New York at Albany, first through the Institute for Northeast Anthropology and later by the Institute for Archeological Studies. Through the period covered in this collection, Dean R. Snow of the State University of New York at Albany served as the magazine's editor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Man in the Northeast Newsletter Collection, 1982-1991. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Man in the Northeast Collection Papers).
